00020 #define VALGRIND_COMPATIBLE
00021 
00022 #include <cassert>
00023 
00024 namespace boost {
00025 namespace xint {
00026 namespace detail {
00027 
00028 static const size_t datasize = (sizeof(data_t)+sizeof(digit_t)-1) /
00029     sizeof(digit_t);
00030 static const size_t minimum_digits = 1, digits_in_struct = 1;
00031 
00032 void zero(digit_t *p, digit_t *end) {
00033     while (p < end) *p++ = 0;
00034 }
00035 
00036 void zero(digit_t *p, size_t size) {
00037     zero(p, p + size);
00038 }
00039 
00040 data_t *allocate(size_t max_digits, size_t initial_length, digit_t mask) {
00041     max_digits = (std::max)(max_digits, minimum_digits);
00042     size_t count = max_digits - digits_in_struct + datasize;
00043 
00044     try {
00045         #ifdef VALGRIND_COMPATIBLE
00046             void *storage = malloc(count * sizeof(digit_t));
00047             data_t *r = new(storage) data_t;
00048         #else
00049             digit_t *storage(new digit_t[count]);
00050             data_t *r = new(reinterpret_cast<void*>(storage)) data_t;
00051         #endif
00052         r->copies=0;
00053         r->length=(std::min)(initial_length, max_digits);
00054         r->max_length=max_digits;
00055         r->fixed_mask=mask;
00056         zero(r->magnitude, r->length);
00057         return r;
00058     } catch (std::bad_alloc&) {
00059         throw exceptions::overflow_error("Out of memory allocating integer");
00060     }
00061 }
00062 
00063 data_t *allocate_fixed(digit_t mask, size_t max_digits, size_t initial_length) {
00064     assert(mask != 0);
00065     return allocate(max_digits, initial_length, mask);
00066 }
00067 
00068 data_t *allocate_fixed_zero(digit_t mask, size_t max_digits) {
00069     data_t *r=allocate(max_digits, 1, mask);
00070     r->copies = 1;
00071     return r;
00072 }
00073 
00074 data_t *reallocate(data_t *olddata, size_t newsize) {
00075     if (olddata==0) {
00076         data_t *newdata=allocate(newsize);
00077         newdata->copies=1;
00078         return newdata;
00079     } else if (olddata->fixed_mask != 0) {
00080         // It's a fixed-size item, have to re-use it.
00081         newsize = (std::min)(newsize, olddata->max_length);
00082         if (olddata->length < newsize) zero(olddata->magnitude +
00083             olddata->length, olddata->magnitude + newsize);
00084         olddata->length = newsize;
00085         return olddata;
00086     } else if (olddata->copies == 1 && newsize <= olddata->max_length) {
00087         // We can re-use this data.
00088         if (olddata->length < newsize) zero(olddata->magnitude +
00089             olddata->length, olddata->magnitude + newsize);
00090         olddata->length = newsize;
00091         return olddata;
00092     } else {
00093         // Have to allocate new data.
00094         data_t *newdata=allocate(newsize, 0);
00095         newdata->copies = 1;
00096         newdata->length = newsize;
00097 
00098         digit_t *s = olddata->magnitude, *se = s + olddata->length,
00099             *t = newdata->magnitude, *te = t + newdata->length;
00100         while (s!=se) *t++ = *s++;
00101         zero(t, te);
00102 
00103         if (--olddata->copies == 0) deallocate(olddata);
00104         return newdata;
00105     }
00106 }
00107 
00108 void deallocate(data_t *data) {
00109     data->~data_t();
00110     digit_t *digits=reinterpret_cast<digit_t*>(data);
00111 
00112     #ifdef XINT_SECURE
00113     zero(digits, data->max_length + datasize - digits_in_struct);
00114     #endif
00115 
00116     #ifdef VALGRIND_COMPATIBLE
00117         free(digits);
00118     #else
00119         delete[] digits;
00120     #endif
00121 }

00124 // bitqueue_t functions

00126 void bitqueue_t::push(doubledigit_t bits, size_t count) {
00127     if (count < ddbits) {
00128         doubledigit_t mask = (doubledigit_t(1) << count) - 1;
00129         bits &= mask;
00130     }
00131 
00132     if (pending.empty()) {
00133         pending.push(std::make_pair(bits, count));
00134     } else {
00135         indata_t &n(pending.back());
00136         if (n.second + count <= ddbits) {
00137             n.first |= bits << n.second;
00138             n.second += count;
00139         } else {
00140             pending.push(std::make_pair(bits, count));
00141         }
00142     }
00143     bits_pending += count;
00144 }
00145 
00146 doubledigit_t bitqueue_t::pop(size_t requestedbits) {
00147     doubledigit_t buffer = 0;
00148     size_t bits_in_buffer = 0;
00149     while (bits_in_buffer < requestedbits && !pending.empty()) {
00150         indata_t &n(pending.front());
00151         size_t maxbits = requestedbits - bits_in_buffer, actualbits =
00152             (std::min)(n.second, maxbits);
00153         buffer |= (n.first << bits_in_buffer);
00154 
00155         n.first >>= actualbits;
00156         n.second -= actualbits;
00157         bits_in_buffer += actualbits;
00158         bits_pending -= actualbits;
00159 
00160         if (n.second == 0) pending.pop();
00161     }
00162     return (buffer & ((doubledigit_t(1) << requestedbits) - 1));
00163 }
